Understanding Gradient Boosting: From Theory to Practice

title: Projects
text: Here‚Äôs a collection of my data science projects demonstrating my skills in machine learning, data analysis, and software engineering. Each project showcases real-world problem-solving with Python, Docker, and modern ML workflows.

title: Projects
text:
ü§ñ Machine Learning Projects

Airline Ticket Price Prediction

Overview
Machine learning regression system to predict airline ticket prices, deployed as a containerized application.
Duration: December 2025 ‚Äì Present
Key Achievements

Cleaned, validated, and explored a scraped airline pricing dataset (20,000 records) using Python (pandas, NumPy, Altair), identifying 7 key price drivers to support feature selection and modeling
Prepared an end-to-end preprocessing and prediction workflow, standardizing data inputs and reducing data inconsistencies by 30% through validation and cleaning steps
Containerized the ML workflow using Docker, enabling reproducible execution across environments and eliminating environment-specific dependency issues during setup and testing

Technical Stack

Languages: Python
Libraries: pandas, NumPy, Altair, scikit-learn
Deployment: Docker
Tools: Jupyter Lab, Git

Skills Demonstrated

Data cleaning and validation
Feature engineering and selection
Regression modeling
Containerization and reproducible workflows


GitHub Repo | Documentation




Term Deposit Classification

Overview
Binary classification system to predict customer term deposit subscriptions for targeted marketing campaigns.
Duration: November 2025 ‚Äì December 2025
Key Achievements

Validated and explored a bank marketing dataset (4,000 records) using Python, identifying 14 features strongly correlated with term-deposit subscription outcomes
Built and tested reproducible analysis workflows, reducing data inconsistencies by 30% and eliminating environment-related failures through validation scripts and dependency debugging
Delivered a Quarto report translating analytical findings into business insights, outlining targeting strategies with potential to improve campaign response rates by 10% based on feature-driven segmentation

Technical Stack

Languages: Python
Libraries: pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn
Reporting: Quarto
Tools: Git, Jupyter Lab

Skills Demonstrated

Binary classification
Feature correlation analysis
Model evaluation and validation
Business insight communication
Reproducible research workflows


GitHub Repo | Quarto Report

Time series analysis and forecasting using ARIMA and Prophet
Interactive geospatial visualizations

Notebook: Jupyter, Quarto

Results

Published findings as interactive report
Featured on [Platform Name]
5K+ views and positive feedback from data community

title: Projects
text:
üîç Natural Language Processing

Multi-Class Sentiment Analysis System
Overview
Developed a state-of-the-art sentiment classification system for product reviews using transformer models and transfer learning.
Key Features

Fine-tuned BERT model for domain-specific sentiment
Support for 5-class sentiment (very negative to very positive)
Aspect-based sentiment analysis
Multi-language support (English, Spanish, French)
RESTful API with FastAPI

Technical Stack

ML: Python, PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers
NLP: spaCy, NLTK, SentencePiece
Deployment: Docker, AWS Lambda, API Gateway

Results

91% accuracy on test set (SOTA benchmark)
Processing 1000+ reviews per second
Deployed in production for e-commerce platform


GitHub Repo | API Docs




Automated Document Classification
Overview
Built an intelligent document classification system to automatically categorize and route incoming business documents.
Key Features

Multi-modal learning (text + layout + metadata)
Transfer learning from pre-trained language models
Active learning loop for continuous improvement
OCR integration for scanned documents
Confidence scoring and human-in-the-loop validation

Technical Stack

ML: Python, TensorFlow, BERT, LayoutLM
OCR: Tesseract, Amazon Textract
Storage: S3, MongoDB

Results

95% classification accuracy across 20 categories
Reduced manual processing time by 70%
Handling 10K+ documents daily


GitHub Repo

Causal Inference in Observational Studies
Overview
Research project investigating novel methods for estimating treatment effects in observational healthcare data.
Key Contributions

Implemented and compared multiple causal inference methods
Developed improved propensity score matching algorithm
Conducted sensitivity analysis for unmeasured confounding
Validated findings using real-world medical datasets

Technical Stack

Languages: R, Python
Libraries: CausalML, DoWhy, EconML
Statistical Methods: Propensity Score Matching, Difference-in-Differences, IV

Publications

Presented at UBC Data Science Research Symposium

title: About Me
text:
Hi! I‚Äôm Chikire

With a strong foundation in statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization, I enjoy working on projects that have real-world impact.
